meta.name: Ghosts of Onigawa Investigator Expansion
meta.description: The Ghosts of Onigawa Investigator Expansion contains 100 new player cards, including 6 custom investigators.
meta.author: Myriad

cards.back_flavor: Bred from birth to take on the mantle of shrine maiden of her village, Yuki endured all manner of grueling "training" as a young girl in pursuit of her ultimate vocation. Unfortunately, the final rite to "purify" her soul involved an arcane ritual which went haywire and left Yuki stricken by a sort of trauma-induced amnesia. That fateful night, Yuki fled the village in a panic and managed to steal away to Arkham, where she eventually cultivated a life of service tending to the city's poverty-stricken and dispossessed masses. Her kind and patient demeanor draws the tormented to her like a lodestone, and as her good works multiply so too have the memories of what she left behind started to resurface...
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0–5, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0–1, [[Blessed]] cards level 0–5, Neutral cards level 0–5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Apotheosis, The Succession, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Weapon]] assets.
cards.flavor: "I must perform my sacred duty... No matter the cost."
cards.name: Yuki Yagami
cards.text:
[reaction]: After you resolve at least 1 [bless] token during a successful skill test: Draw 1 card.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may search the chaos bag for a [curse] token and return it to the token pool.

cards.flavor: The sacred bloodline of the goddess Amaterasu was carefully preserved until a suitable vessel for her essence could be found.
cards.name: Apotheosis
cards.text:
Yuki Yagami deck only.
[reaction] When your turn begins: Add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag.
[reaction]  After your turn ends: Search the chaos bag for 1 [curse] token and return it to the token pool.

cards.flavor: Many who undergo the shrine maiden "training" are unable to speak of it.
cards.name: The Succession
cards.text: Revelation - Put The Succession into play and seal all [bless] tokens in the chaos bag on it. Forced - When a [bless] token would be added to the chaos bag: Seal it on this and add a [curse] token to the chaos bag, instead. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, release all tokens sealed here and discard The Succession.

cards.back_flavor: Makoto has amassed a small fortune renting out her services as a "consort" to Arkham's well-paying elite. Though her expertise in massage therapy and exotic musical instruments are considerable, she is most recommended by far for her insight as a counselor and empathic confidant. But her uncanny ability to see into the minds of the rich and powerful and divine their hearts' true desires is no mere parlor trick; when her grandmother passed away, Makoto inherited a number of family heirlooms, including a strange ornamental headdress... The first time she tried it on, Makoto discovered that she was suddenly capable of perceiving a level of reality that lies hidden to most. So many long nights she has spent gazing into that abyss that it has begun to gaze back into her, as well...
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0–5, Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0–1, [[Patron]] cards level 0–5, [[Gambit]] cards level 0–5, Neutral cards level 0–5. Deckbuilding Requirements: The Infinite Oculus, Porcelain Mirage, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions (do not count toward deck size): No non-[[Patron]] assets that take up an ally slot.
cards.flavor: "The truth will set you free."
cards.name: Makoto Miyazaki
cards.text:
Reduce the difficulty of skill tests you perform during parley actions by 1.
[reaction] After a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters play: Disengage from that enemy, if able. That enemy cannot engage you until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +X. X is the number of enemies in play.

cards.flavor: All secrets are laid bare beneath the mask's withering gaze.
cards.name: The Infinite Oculus
cards.text:
Makoto Miyazaki deck only.
Limit 1 [[Headgear]] per investigator.
You get +1 [intellect] for each enemy at your location.
[reaction] When the investigation phase begins, if there is at least one enemy at your location: Gain 1 resource.

cards.flavor:
Whatever truth there may be in beauty, 
it remains only skin deep.
cards.name: Porcelain Mirage
cards.text: Revelation - Put Porcelain Mirage into play in your threat area. Your location gets +1 shroud. [action] Spend 4 resources: Discard Porcelain Mirage.

cards.back_flavor: The sole surviving member of ancient order of clandestine assassins that was driven to near extinction following a failed "hostile takeover" by the Syndicate, Hideki was given the choice of a slow and painful death or a life of indentured servitude to his new criminal overlords. While he considers the types of contracts the Syndicate typically assigns him to be beneath both his honor and his talent, Arkham has proven to be a valuable training ground to better hone his craft. While he bides his time, Hideki has ultimately grown to view his new patrons as a means to a very particular end; while he builds his reputation for ruthless efficiency, so too does his clan grow closer to being restored to its former glory...
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0–5, Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0–1, [[Tactic]] cards level 0–5, Neutral cards level 0–5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Nabiki Nagata, Survivor's Guilt, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Firearm]] assets.
cards.flavor: "Though I may strike from the shadows, do not think I lack the courage to stand in the light."
cards.name: Hideki Honda
cards.text:
[free]: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location that is not engaged with you. (Limit once per round)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may automatically evade 1 non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location.

cards.flavor: Only one of Hideki's pupils has ever shown real promise.
cards.name: Nabiki Nagata
cards.text: Hideki Honda deck only. You get +1 [agility] [free] Discard Nabiki Nagata: Evade. Automatically evade all non-[[Elite]] enemies at your location.

cards.flavor: He couldn't save anyone. He can't even save himself.
cards.name: Survivor's Guilt
cards.text: Revelation - Put Survivor's Guilt into play in your threat area. Forced - After you succeed at a skill test: Take 1 direct horror. [action][action]: Discard Survivor's Guilt. You may activate this ability only if you control an [[Ally]] asset.

cards.back_flavor: As a practitioner of the ancient art of Onmyōdō, Akira has devoted his life to research and mastery of the boundary between life and death. He prefers, whenever possible, to spend his time communicating with the spirits of the deceased, in order to learn arcane secrets that are simply beyond the reach of most modern occult practitioners. The natural ease with which he is able to draw upon knowledge and power from the antecedent magi in his bloodline via a highly developed "genetic memory" has made him somewhat arrogant and detached from the affairs of our world, but he is beloved by common folk for his ability to banish vengeful apparitions and help still living souls find closure by making contact with the spirits of their deceased loved ones. Despite his already considerable power, Akira still finds himself hungering for answers to ever more dangerous questions...
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0–5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0–1, [[Practiced]] cards level 0–5, Neutral cards level 0–5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Living Memory, Liminal Breach, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Tarot]] assets.
cards.flavor: "A thousand generations live on in me."
cards.name: Akira Arisato
cards.text:
[reaction] When a non-weakness skill card would be placed in the discard pile of an investigator at your location: Shuffle that card into its owner's deck instead. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may return a card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.flavor: "Nothing is truly lost until it is forgotten."
cards.name: Living Memory
cards.text: Akira Arisato deck only. You may commit the top-most skill card in your discard pile as through it were in your hand. If that card would be discarded when the test ends, place it on the bottom of your deck, instead. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
Many souls that have passed from our world 
would do anything to return to it.
cards.name: Liminal Breach
cards.text: Revelation - Put Liminal Breach into play with 1 doom on it. [action] If there is no doom on Liminal Breach: Discard it. [action]: Test [willpower] (5). If you succeed, remove 1 doom from Liminal Breach.

cards.back_flavor: Orphaned at a early age under mysterious circumstances, Sakura was adopted and raised by a superstitious blacksmith living in a remote village outside of Arkham. One day, the smith became despondent after catching his young ward "playing" with a blade he had forged, and soon abandoned his craft. Suspecting the influence of evil spirits, Sakura left the village when the smith died but took the sword with her, vowing to ensure her foster father's magnum opus would be put to good use against the forces of darkness that threaten the lives of innocents, wherever they may lurk.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30 Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0–5, Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0–1, [[Spirit]] cards level 0–5, Neutral cards level 0–5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Live by the Sword, Die by the Sword, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Firearm]] assets.
cards.flavor: "You won't live long enough to remember my name."
cards.name: Sakura Sanada
cards.text:
[reaction]When you play a [[Spirit]] card: Reduce its resource cost by 1 or gain 1 resource.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may shuffle a [[Spirit]] card from your discard pile back into your deck.

cards.flavor: "Anyone can die. It's living that requires courage."
cards.name: Live by the Sword
cards.text:
Sakura Sanada deck only.
You gain an additional action during your turn which can only be used to engage or fight an enemy.

cards.flavor: Death before dishonor.
cards.name: Die by the Sword
cards.text: Revelation - Put Die by the Sword into play in your threat area. Enemies in your threat area get +1 fight and you deal +1 damage when you fail a skill test while fighting an enemy engaged with another investigator. [action] Take 2 damage or discard an [[Ally]] asset from your hand or play area: Discard Die by the Sword.

cards.back_flavor: Mayu grew up in the country outside of Arkham, in the remote farming hamlet of Minakami Village, along with her sister Miyu. The death of the twins' mother left them orphaned at a young age, but the civic-minded townsfolk all pitched into ensure the girls were well taken care of, allowing them to grow up happy and carefree. Everything changed on the night of their thirteenth birthday, however, when the twins found themselves drawn into a mysterious portal hidden in the forest outside of town and became trapped within a terrifying "time loop." Mayu eventually managed to escape unharmed, but Miyu was never seen again. Mayu moved to Arkham to put some distance between herself and the memories of that day, but recently has found herself visited by a mysterious crimson butterfly that seems to be calling her home...
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose either Seeker ([seeker]) or Survivor ([survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0–5, Neutral cards level 0–5, and cards level 0–2 of your chosen secondary class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Camera Obscura, Molochean Usurper, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Composure]] assets.
cards.flavor: "I made a promise to my sister..."
cards.name: Mayu Tachibana
cards.text:
[reaction] After an enemy at your location is evaded: Draw 1 card.
[free]: Move 1 charge from Camera Obscura to another asset you control with "uses (charges)." (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If you succeed, you may place 1 charge on Camera Obscura.

cards.name: Camera Obscura
cards.text: Mayu Tachibana deck only. You get +1 [willpower]. Uses (4 charges.) [action]: Evade. Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this test. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may spend 1 charge to deal 1 damage to the evaded enemy.

cards.flavor: Trapped within the perpetual twilight of Onigawa, Mayu's twin sister had aeons to realize the power of their sacred bloodline...and reclaim the fallen empire as her own.
cards.name: Molochean Usurper
cards.text: Hunter 2. Prey - Bearer only. Molochean Usurper cannot be damaged unless it is exhausted.

cards.flavor: Even the greatest story ever told has two sides.
cards.name: Iscariot's Apocrypha
cards.text: [action] If Iscariot's Apocrypha is ready: Investigate. If this investigation is successful and you resolved a [bless] or [elder_sign] token, discover an additional clue from your location. As an additional cost to initiate this ability, you may exhaust this to add a [bless] token to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor: If you desire peace, you must prepare for war.
cards.name: Parabellum
cards.text:
Parabellum does not ready during the upkeep phase.
[reaction] After you fail a skill test while fighting during your turn, exhaust Parabellum: You gain an additional action this turn which can only be used to fight or engage an enemy. 
[action]: Ready Parabellum.

cards.flavor: Blessed are the peacekeepers.
cards.name: Sofia Wallace
cards.text:
You get +1 [willpower]. 
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test in which you resolved a [bless] token, exhaust Sofia Wallace: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.

cards.name: Safe Haven
cards.text:
Attach Safe Haven to your current location. Limit 1 per location.
[reaction] When your turn begins, if there are no enemies at the attached location: Add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag.
[reaction] If Safe Haven is ready when an enemy enters the attached location: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [bless] token, exhaust Safe Haven and deal 1 damage to that enemy.

cards.flavor: "We all must pay for the violence of our ancestors."
cards.name: Ancestral Favor
cards.text:
After you commit Ancestral Favor to a skill test, you may add a [bless] token to the chaos bag.
The performing investigator may return all [bless] tokens resolved during this test to the chaos bag instead of the token pool after this test ends.

cards.flavor: "We're alive...and we're together."
cards.name: Nothing Else Matters
cards.text: If this test is successful, you may add Nothing Else Matters to the hand of another investigator at your location instead of discarding it after this test ends.

cards.flavor: "You'll have to go through me, first."
cards.name: Someone Your Own Size
cards.text: Limit 1 [[Posture]] per investigator. [reaction] When an enemy would attack another investigator at your location (before resolving that attack), exhaust Someone Your Own Size: Fight. This action targets the attacking enemy. Ignore the retaliate keyword for this attack.

cards.flavor: "They'll never see us coming."
cards.name: Coordinated Infiltration
cards.text: Echo 1 (until the end of the round, each other investigator may play Coordinated Infiltration from its owner's discard pile once.) Choose a connecting location. Each investigator may pay 1 resource to move one location towards the chosen location.

cards.flavor: "They always did have a penchant for the dramatic..."
cards.name: Better Late Than Never
cards.text: Echo 1 (until the end of the round, each other investigator may play Better Late Than Never from its owner's discard pile once.) Search your deck for an [[Ally]] asset, then set it aside, shuffle your deck, and place the set-aside card on top of your deck. Reduce the cost of by 1 for each doom in play.

cards.flavor:
The surface of the cube writhes 
as it struggles to contain infinite possibilities.
cards.name: The Obsidian Manifold
cards.text:
Limit 1 per deck. 
[free] Discard The Obsidian Manifold: Search your deck for an asset that takes up at least 1 hand slot and draw it. You may immediately play that asset, reducing its cost by 3. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor:
"Bravery simply means 
that you are afraid of the right things."
cards.name: Indomitable
cards.text: Commit only to a skill test you are performing. If this test fails, you may take 1 direct damage to attempt this test again (after resolving all effects from the failed test), committing Indomitable to it.

cards.flavor: You always have something left to lose.
cards.name: Martyrdom
cards.text:
Fast. Play only when another investigator would be assigned damage and/or horror that would defeat them.
Cancel that damage and/or horror. You may add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag for each point of damage or horror canceled in this way. You are defeated.

cards.flavor:
"I will restore the honor of my house, 
no matter what it takes."
cards.name: Kasumi Katsura
cards.text:
You get +1 [agility].
[action] If you are not engaged with an enemy, exhaust Kasumi Katsura: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location or a connecting location.

cards.flavor: All death is certain.
cards.name: First Principles
cards.text:
Fast. Play after you assign damage to your investigator.
Discover 1 clue from your location.

cards.flavor: Fortune favors the bold.
cards.name: One Way to Find Out
cards.text:
Play only as your first action.
Choose an unrevealed location that is connected to a revealed location and move to it. Then, if there is at least 1 clue at that location, you may take an investigate action. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor:
"The mind of your enemy 
wraps its secrets in its symbols."
cards.name: Symbolic Enigma
cards.text: Investigators at your location draw a total of X cards, distributed as you wish. X is the shroud value of your current location.

cards.flavor: All you need is a change in perspective.
cards.name: Visual Calculus
cards.text: Investigate. Choose a connecting location with the most clues and add the shroud value of the chosen location to your location's shroud value for this test. If you succeed, discover an additional clue from a connecting location.

cards.flavor: "No one knows what it means to hunt well like the hunted."
cards.name: Adopt and Adapt
cards.text:
Adopt and Adapt gains [wild] for each enemy at the performing investigator's location and each connecting location.
Non-[[Elite]] enemies at the performing investigator's location lose retaliate and alert for the duration of this skill test.

cards.flavor: "What's the worst that could happen?"
cards.name: Trailblazer
cards.text:
Limit 1 [[Posture]] per investigator. 
[reaction] When an enemy would attack you, place 1 of your clues on your location and exhaust Trailblazer: Cancel that attack.

cards.flavor: "All I need are a sharp knife and some smelling salts..."
cards.name: Field Autopsy
cards.text: Fast. Play after an enemy is defeated at your location. Investigate. You get +X [intellect] for this investigation and if you succeed, you may discover up to X additional clues from your location. X is the defeated enemy's printed horror value.

cards.flavor: Some things defy rational explanation.
cards.name: Reason to Believe
cards.text: [reaction] After you resolve at least 1 [bless] or [elder_sign] token during a successful investigation, exhaust Reason to Believe: Discover an additional clue from your location.

cards.flavor: "No, I don't know what I'm doing... That's why it's going to work."
cards.name: Method to the Madness
cards.text:
Fast. Uses (2 secrets).
[reaction] After you assign any amount of horror to your investigator: Place that many secrets on Method to the Madness.
[free] Spend X secrets and exhaust Method to the Madness: You get +X skill value for this test.

cards.flavor: Nothing ever ends.
cards.name: Terrible Symmetry
cards.text:
Fast. Play only when your turn begins.
Discard all non-weakness cards from your hand. Until the end of the round, you may play other event cards in your discard pile as though they were in your hand. If you do and they would be discarded, shuffle them into your deck instead.

cards.flavor:
"The source code of the universe describes 
a purely geometric operating system."
cards.name: Geometric Unity
cards.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate, exhaust Geometric Unity: Discover an additional clue from any revealed location with a shroud value lower than every location you have already discovered a clue from this turn.

cards.flavor: "What do we say to the tariff collectors, boys? Not today!"
cards.name: “Banzai" Stiletto
cards.text:
You get +1 [combat].
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust "Banzai" Stiletto: Gain 1 resource.

cards.flavor: "You'll be fine. Just don't look down."
cards.name: Escape Rope
cards.text: [free] If you are not engaged with an enemy, exhaust Escape Rope: Choose a revealed connecting location and test [agility] (X), where X is the chosen location's shroud value. If you succeed, move to the chosen location.

cards.flavor: Before their use was outlawed and the art became largely forgotten, over fifty different schools of shurikenjutsu were practiced.
cards.name: Honed Shuriken
cards.text: Uses (5 ammo). If Honed Shuriken has no ammo, discard it. [action] If you are not engaged with an enemy, spend 1 ammo: Fight. Add your [agility] to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage.

cards.flavor: The clockwork appendage contains several hidden compartments.
cards.name: Trick Limb
cards.text:
Permanent. Purchase at deck creation.
When you purchase Trick Limb, suffer 2 physical trauma.
You have 3 additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Tool]] assets that take up exactly 1 hand slot.

cards.flavor:
It is only dishonorable to attack an unaware 
adversary if you aren't getting paid for it.
cards.name: Marked for Death
cards.text:
Fast. Play only when a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters play. Attach Marked for Death to that enemy. Limit 1 per enemy.
The attached enemy gets –1 fight. 
[reaction] After you defeat the attached enemy: Gain 2 resources.

cards.flavor: "Read ’em and weep!"
cards.name: Make My Own Luck
cards.text: Before resolving chaos tokens for this test, the performing investigator may return one revealed chaos token to the chaos bag and reveal two additional chaos tokens. If this skill test is successful, the performing investigator gains 2 resources.

cards.flavor:
"A gauntlet packed with gunpowder can be a 
powerful tool...in the right hands."
cards.name: Charcoal Grease
cards.text: [reaction] As an additional cost to perform a fight action using a [[Melee]] asset you control, exhaust Charcoal Grease: This attack deals +1 damage.

cards.flavor: Sometimes, its just about sending a message.
cards.name: Insult to Injury
cards.text:
Limit 1 [[Posture]] per investigator. 
[reaction] After dealing damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy while fighting, exhaust Insult to Injury: Automatically evade the damaged enemy.

cards.flavor: "I'm unarmed, see? Have a closer look..."
cards.name: Hidden Blade
cards.text:
Uses (3 secrets). 
[free] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Hidden Blade: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of  [combat]. This attack may only target an enemy that is not engaged with you and automatically succeeds if targeting an enemy with 1 remaining health.

cards.flavor: Don't believe everything you see.
cards.name: Mirror Image
cards.text: Fast. Play only when your turn begins. Echo 1 (until the end of the round, each other investigator may play Mirror Image from its owner's discard pile once.) Until the end of the round, whenever you take a basic fight, basic evade, or move action, you may take that action again (unless that action was taken via this effect).

cards.name: Sapphire and Lapis
cards.text: [action] If Sapphire and Lapis is ready: Fight. Add your [agility] to your skill value for this attack. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage and you may exhaust Sapphire and Lapis to fight again. [reaction] After you are attacked by an enemy during the enemy phase, exhaust Sapphire and Lapis: Fight. Add your [agility] to your skill value for this attack. This attack targets the attacking enemy.

cards.flavor: "It's not gambling! It's just...counting."
cards.name: Full Count
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [intellect] (X), where X is the number of tokens sealed on Full Count. If you fail, release all tokens sealed here. [reaction] When a non-[auto_fail] chaos token would be returned to the chaos bag, if it was not released from a card, exhaust Full Count: Seal that token here, instead.

cards.flavor: Akane's appreciation of live music began as a child, when she observed a beautiful young bard banish a vengeful spirit from her village.
cards.name: Akane Amada
cards.text:
[reaction] When an enemy would perform an attack of opportunity against an investigator at your location, exhaust Akane Amada: Cancel that attack.
[reaction] After an enemy is evaded at your location, exhaust Akane Amada: Gain 1 resource.

cards.flavor: "You don't belong in this world!"
cards.name: Exorcism
cards.text: [action]: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. If you resolve a [bless] or [elder_sign] token during this skill test or if this attack targets a [[Spectral]] or [[Yokai]] enemy, it deals +1 damage.

cards.name: Parasitic Host
cards.text: [action] If Parasitic Host is ready: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If this attack is successful, you may take 1 damage to have this attack deal +1 damage, and if this attack defeats an enemy, you may exhaust Parasitic Host to heal 1 damage from it. Forced - When your turn ends: If you did not successfully fight with Parasitic Host this turn, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, Parasitic Host deals 1 damage to you.

cards.flavor: "I have eyes everywhere."
cards.name: Remote Viewing
cards.text: [free] Exhaust Remote Viewing: Look at either the top card of the encounter deck, the top card of an investigator's deck, or the revealed side of an unrevealed connecting location.

cards.flavor: Taking a secret to your grave just isn't enough these days.
cards.name: Spellbinding Seance
cards.text:
Uses (3 charges). 
[reaction] When an enemy is defeated at your location, spend 1 charge from Spellbinding Seance: Discover 1 clue at your location.

cards.flavor: "There are no limits. Everything is permitted."
cards.name: Hidden Potential
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Hidden Potential, discard 2 non-weakness cards from your hand or play area.
Draw 3 cards. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor: "You've already given me everything I need."
cards.name: Fan the Flames
cards.text:
Limit 1 [[Posture]] per investigator. 
[reaction] After an enemy engages you, exhaust Fan the Flames: Choose a [mystic] asset you control with "uses (charges)" and test [willpower] (X), where X is the number of charges on the chosen asset. If you succeed, place a charge on the chosen asset.

cards.flavor: Wara ningyō are used in a number of rituals, most often combined with something from the intended recipient of a curse, such as a piece of hair.
cards.name: Rope Effigy
cards.text: [reaction] After an enemy enters play, exhaust Rope Effigy: Seal 1 [curse] token from the chaos bag on that enemy. [action] Choose an enemy with a [curse] token sealed on it: Parley. Deal 1 damage to the chosen enemy. If this effect defeats an enemy, you may return a [curse] token sealed on it to the token pool.

cards.flavor: "Wait. Something's wrong..."
cards.name: Flicker
cards.text:
Fast. Play during any [free] window.
Choose a non-weakness asset you control and return it to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: If you can't beat them, f'taghn.
cards.name: Surrender to Madness
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
As an additional cost to play Surrender to Madness, you suffer 1 mental trauma.
Until the end of the round, the base value of each of your skills is equal to the amount of horror on your investigator.

cards.flavor: As above, so below.
cards.name: Sidereal Schism
cards.text:
Permanent. 
[reaction] When the game begins: Reveal tokens from the chaos bag until you reveal a token that isn't [elder_sign] or [auto_fail].You may seal that token here.

cards.flavor: In brightest day, or blackest night.
cards.name: Eventide
cards.text: Forced - When Eventide enters play: Place 1 doom on it. [action]: Fight. Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this attack. If Eventide has doom on it, this attack deals +2 damage. Otherwise, this attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy with doom on it, you may move that doom to Eventide.

cards.flavor: "C'mon! Just let me hold it for a minute..."
cards.name: Give and Take
cards.text: [free] Give control of Give and Take to another investigator at your location and exhaust Give and Take: Take control of a [[Item]] asset controlled by that investigator.

cards.flavor: "Get out of my kitchen!"
cards.name: Kentaro Kobayashi
cards.text:
You have 1 additional hand slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Tool]] asset. 
[action][action]: Heal 1 damage. This ability may be activated by any investigator at your location.

cards.flavor: Those who never love give no hostage to fortune.
cards.name: Bury the Light
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
As an additional cost to play Bury the Light, discard a non-weakness asset that takes up at least 1 ally slot from your hand or play area.
Gain X resources, where X is the discarded asset's printed resource cost.

cards.flavor: Caution is a luxury you simply cannot afford.
cards.name: Light the Way
cards.text:
Fast. Play when the investigation phase begins.
Until the end of the round, other investigators may commit cards to tests you perform as though they were at your location and cards committed by other investigators to tests you perform gain [wild].

cards.flavor: Time and tide wait for no one.
cards.name: Trawl the Shallows
cards.text: Discard the top X cards of your deck, where X is your location's shroud value. If any weaknesses are discarded in this way, shuffle them back into your deck. Then, choose a card from among the top X cards in your discard pile and add it to your hand.

cards.flavor:
There is no shame in defeat, 
so long as the spirit remains unconquered.
cards.name: Now or Never
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Now or Never gains [wild] [wild] if the performing investigator has failed at least one skill test this round.

cards.flavor:
"The greatest warrior need never fear the second 
greatest warrior; they need only fear the novice 
who has never held a weapon before."
cards.name: Reckless Abandon
cards.text:
Limit 1 [[Posture]] per investigator. 
[free] Take 1 damage and exhaust Reckless Abandon: This attack deals +1 damage.

cards.flavor: "Failure is an excellent teacher."
cards.name: Limit Break
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
You gain an additional action this turn. If you have 3 or fewer remaining health, remove Limit Break from the game. Otherwise, exile Limit Break.

cards.flavor: Time heals all wounds. It will cause many more.
cards.name: Turn from the Ruin
cards.text:
Fast. Play after an investigator fails a skill test. X is the amount they failed by.
The performing investigator may draw up to X cards.

cards.flavor: "Our bonds grew together like roots underground until at last we found that we were one tree and not two."
cards.name: Destiny Bond
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose an investigator. The next action you perform this turn may be performed as if you were at the chosen investigator's location. Remove Destiny Bond from the game.

cards.flavor:
The best defense the mind has 
is simply forgetting to remember.
cards.name: Selective Memory
cards.text:
Permanent. Exceptional. 
[reaction] Before you draw your opening hand: Search your deck for up to 5 non-weakness cards and discard them. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor: Not all who wander are lost.
cards.name: Wanderlust
cards.text:
Permanent. 
[reaction] When your turn ends, if your current location is not the same one where you started your turn: Draw 1 card.

cards.flavor: "We all cast our own shadows."
cards.name: The Hermit's Heresy
cards.text: As an additional cost to play this, take 1 direct damage. Forced - After you succeed at a skill test: Add 1 [bless] token and 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag. While there are at least 4 [bless] or 4 [curse] tokens in the chaos bag, you get +1 [intellect] while investigating.

cards.flavor:
Those who have attained true mastery of the sword 
will never find themselves without a blade.
cards.name: Keening Katana
cards.text: [action] If Keening Katana is ready: Fight. For this attack, you may use [agility] instead of [combat] and you get +1 skill value. If you succeed by 2 or more, this attack deals +1 damage. If you fail by 2 or more, exhaust Keening Katana.

cards.flavor: "Its purpose is to remind us that we are always dangerously close to something better left unknown."
cards.name: Sulfuric Censer
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
You get +1 [willpower]. 
[reaction] After Sulfuric Censer enters play: Add up to 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor:
"It was much smaller, at first, but then I noticed that every time 
I began to doubt, the lattice of runes grew more labyrinthine..."
cards.name: The Believer's Burden
cards.text: As an additional cost to play The Believer's Burden, take 1 direct damage. Forced - After you fail a skill test: If The Believer's Burden is ready, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag or exhaust The Believer's Burden. While The Believer's Burden is ready, you get +1 [willpower].

cards.flavor: "It made me an offer I couldn't refuse."
cards.name: The Devil's Due
cards.text: As an additional cost to play this The Devil's Due, take 1 direct damage. Forced - At the start of your turn: Pay 1 resource or exhaust The Devil's Due. While The Devil's Due is ready, you may ignore the first attack of opportunity you would take each turn.

cards.flavor: Utilized as a specialized "calculator" to forecast future events, the exact mechanics of this esoteric device are understood only by a select few.
cards.name: Hermetic Abacus
cards.text: [reaction] After the last clue is discovered at your location, exhaust Hermetic Abacus: Look at the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is your location's shroud value. [action] If Hermetic Abacus is ready: Investigate. Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this investigation. If you fail, exhaust Hermetic Abacus.

cards.flavor: Whether you remain the ash or become the phoenix is up to you.
cards.name: The Phoenix's Pathos
cards.text: As an additional cost to play The Phoenix's Pathos, take 1 direct damage. Forced - After an enemy at your location takes damage: Exhaust The Phoenix's Pathos. While The Phoenix's Pathos is ready and an enemy is at your location or a connecting location, you get +1 [intellect] while investigating.

cards.flavor:
"Blood moves the wheels of history; 
don't be afraid to spill some."
cards.name: Harakiri
cards.text:
[reaction] After an enemy becomes engaged with you, exhaust Harakiri: Draw 1 card. 
[free] Take 1 direct damage and discard Harakiri: Draw 2 cards.

cards.flavor: "There are no people like me. Not anymore."
cards.name: The Serpent's Sacrifice
cards.text: As an additional cost to play The Serpent's Sacrifice, take 1 direct damage. Forced - If The Serpent's Sacrifice is ready when you defeat an enemy: Take 1 damage or exhaust The Serpent's Sacrifice. While The Serpent's Sacrifice is ready, you must use [agility] instead of [combat] while fighting.

cards.flavor: This painful rendering makes it impossible to forget your vows.
cards.name: The Dragon's Dogma
cards.text: As an additional cost to play The Dragon's Dogma, take 1 direct damage. Forced - After you evade an enemy: If The Dragon's Dogma is ready, exhaust The Dragon's Dogma. While The Dragon's Dogma is ready, you get +1 [combat].

cards.flavor: Many choices lie ahead. None of them will be easy.
cards.name: Hell or High Water
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 Hell or High Water per deck. Purchase at deck creation.
[reaction] After taking your initial mulligan: Take an additional mulligan of up to 2 cards.
You begin each game with 2 fewer resources.

cards.flavor: Many choices lie ahead. None of them will be easy.
cards.name: Hell or High Water
cards.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 Hell or High Water per deck. Purchase at deck creation.
You may not mulligan non-weakness cards from your opening hand. 
Your opening hand size is increased by 2.

cards.name: Papercut Lantern
cards.text: Uses (2 supplies). If Papercut Lantern has no supplies, discard it. Forced - When an investigator at your location resolves a [cultist], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token during a skill test: Remove 1 supply from Papercut Lantern. [free] Exhaust Papercut Lantern: Your current location gets –1 shroud until the end of your turn.

cards.flavor: "Every scar is a story... Some are better than others."
cards.name: Skin in the Game
cards.text:
Permanent. Purchase at deck creation.
Your investigator's Deckbuilding Restrictions gain: "No [[Clothing]] assets that take up a body slot."
You have 2 additional body slots, which can only be used to hold [[Brand]] assets.

cards.flavor: It's not paranoia if they really are out to get you.
cards.name: Anticipatory Focus
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Look at the top 1 [per_investigator] cards of the encounter deck. If there are any enemy cards among the looked at cards, you gain an additional action this turn.

cards.flavor:
"If they don't answer your prayers... 
Why do you worship them?"
cards.name: Gods Be Good
cards.text: After this skill test ends, add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag. If this skill test fails, also add 2 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag after this test ends.

cards.flavor:
"It is better to be a warrior in a garden 
than a gardener in a war."
cards.name: Hannya Mask
cards.text:
Limit 1 [[Headgear]] per investigator.
You get +1 [agility] while evading. 
[reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy would engage you, discard Hannya Mask: Exhaust that enemy instead.

cards.flavor: Blink and you'll miss it.
cards.name: Rapid Release
cards.text:
Fast. Play during any [free] window.
Ready a non-weakness asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Exile Rapid Release.

cards.flavor:
Local legends tell of a hound so loyal 
that it took up its deceased master's mantle 
as protector of Minakami's shrines.
cards.name: Koromaru
cards.text: [reaction] After an enemy is defeated at your location, exhaust Koromaru: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location.

cards.flavor:
"Do not concern yourself with "destiny," child... 
In this world, there is no fate but the one we make."
cards.name: Fungible Fate
cards.text:
Permanent.
You have 1 additional tarot slot.

cards.flavor:
Early pioneers in the field of aviation found 
they lacked the vocabulary to describe the 
unnatural state of "unlimited visibility" that 
accompanied an exceptionally clear day.
cards.name: Severe Clear
cards.text:
Attach Severe Clear to your current location. Limit 1 per location.
The attached location and each connecting locations get –1 shroud.

cards.name: Through Thick and Thin
cards.subname: If It Means a Lot to You
cards.text:
Permanent.
Your investigator's Deckbuilding Restrictions gain: "Exactly 1 asset that takes up ally slots." 
[reaction] Before you draw your opening hand or when your deck is empty: Search your deck and discard pile for an asset that takes up an ally slot and attach it to Through Thick and Thin.
Cards attached to Through Thick and Thin may be played as if they were in your hand.

cards.back_flavor: Shinobu was a penniless lush when he was taken under the wing of the legendary drunken master Hiro Hachimura. Under his master's tutelage, Shinobu quickly developed a talent for artisanal brewery but Shinobu's "signature" brew, steeped in absinthe, proved too formidable for even his master to contend with. Ever since the drunken master unexpectedly fell into a coma, his pupil has searched for ever more exotic ingredients to add to his esoteric brewing arsenal, hoping someday to concoct a tincture that may bring his master back...
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose 2 of the following classes: Guardian ([guardian]), Seeker ([seeker]), Rogue ([rogue]), Mystic ([mystic]), or Survivor ([survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Illicit cards level 0–5, Neutral cards level 0–5, and cards level 0–3 of your chosen secondary classes. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Hair of the Dog, Cold Turkey, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Composure]] assets.
cards.flavor:
"No one should reach nirvana without the taste 
of good saké on their lips."
cards.name: Shinobu Sanosuke
cards.text: You begin the game with Hair of the Dog (Absinthe Elixir) in play. [free] Spend 1 supply from Hair of the Dog: You get +1 skill value for this test. (Limit once per turn.) [elder_sign] effect: +X. X is the number of supplies on Hair of the Dog.

cards.name: Hair of the Dog
cards.text: Shinobu Sanosuke deck only. Hair of the Dog cannot leave play. Uses (0 supplies). Forced - When your turn begins: Place 1 supply on Hair of the Dog. Then, if this has exactly... - ...1 supply, you get +1 [combat] until the end of the round. - ...2 supplies, you get +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. - ...3 supplies, you get +1 [intellect] until the end of the round. - ...4 or more supplies, take all supplies on Hair of the Dog as resources.

cards.flavor: You won't find any answers at the bottom of a glass.
cards.name: Cold Turkey
cards.text: Revelation - Remove all supplies from Hair of the Dog and then put Cold Turkey into play in your threat area. Forced - When you would place supplies on Hair of the Dog: Place them on Cold Turkey instead. [action] If there are at least 3 supplies on this: Discard Cold Turkey.

cards.flavor: If you desire peace, you must prepare for war.
cards.name: Parabellum
cards.text: [reaction] After you fail a skill test during your turn while fighting, exhaust Parabellum: You gain an additional action this round which may only be used to fight or engage an enemy.

cards.flavor: Even the greatest story ever told has two sides.
cards.name: Iscariot's Apocrypha
cards.text: [action] If Iscariot's Apocrypha is ready: Investigate. You get +1 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed and at least 1 [bless] or [elder_sign] token wass resolved during the investigation, discover an additional clue from your location. As an additional cost to initiate this ability, you may exhaust Iscariot's Apocrypha to add a [bless] token to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor:
"The mind of your enemy 
wraps its secrets in its symbols."
cards.name: Symbolic Enigma
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Each investigator at your location may draw up to X cards. X is the shroud value of your current location.

cards.flavor: All death is certain.
cards.name: First Principles
cards.text:
Fast. Play only after you assign damage to your investigator.
Discover 2 clues from your location.

cards.flavor:
It is only dishonorable to attack an unaware 
adversary if you aren't getting paid for it.
cards.name: Marked for Death
cards.text:
Fast. Play during any [free] window.
Attach Marked for Death to an unengaged non-[[Elite]] enemy.
The attached enemy gets –1 fight and –1 evade.
[reaction] After the attached enemy is discarded: Gain 2 resources.

cards.flavor: "You don't belong in this world!"
cards.name: Exorcism
cards.text: [action]: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower]. If you resolve a [bless] or [elder_sign] token during this skill test or if this attack targets a [[Spectral]] or [[Yokai]] enemy, it deals +1 damage.

cards.flavor:
"When you look into my eyes... what do you see?"
"They're not your eyes."
cards.name: Flicker
cards.text:
Fast. Play during any [free] window.
Return a non-weakness asset in the play area of an investigator at your location to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "You don't belong in this world!"
cards.name: Exorcism
cards.text: [action]: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +3 [willpower]. If you resolve a [bless] or [elder_sign] token during this skill test or if this attack targets a [[Spectral]] or [[Yokai]] enemy, it deals +2 damage.

cards.flavor:
There is no shame in defeat, 
so long as the spirit remains unconquered.
cards.name: Now or Never
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Now or Never gains [wild] for every test the performing investigator has failed this round.

cards.flavor: Time heals all wounds. It will cause many more.
cards.name: Turn from the Ruin
cards.text:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location fails a skill test.
The performing investigator may draw up to X cards, where X is the amount the performing investigator failed by.

cards.name: Papercut Lantern
cards.text: Uses (4 supplies). If Papercut Lantern has no supplies, discard it. Forced - When an investigator at your location resolves a [cultist], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token during a skill test: Remove 1 supply from Papercut Lantern. [free] Exhaust Papercut Lantern: Your current location gets –1 shroud until the end of your turn.
